intro: Morisonia domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and flowering plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some tropical gardens.
